task_description: Facing the building to your North-West (approx. 297°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the building’s roofline/top and its base clearly to estimate height, so I will tilt the camera upward while keeping the same heading toward the building.
The heading is now 0° (north) rather than ~297° (north‑west), so I should rotate left about 63° to re-center the target building while keeping the upward pitch to see its top.
I’m correctly aimed at ~297° again, but I still need the roofline in view for a height estimate, so I will tilt up while keeping the building centered.
The view keeps snapping to 0° when pitching up, so I should first rotate to ~297° at pitch 30 to keep the target building (NW) in frame.
To estimate height I need both base and top; since pitching up is resetting oddly, I will keep heading and move laterally to get a clearer full-building view.
After the move my heading is ~27° (NE), so I should rotate left about 90° to face the target building again at ~297° (NW).
I’m at 270° (west) and need ~297° (north‑west), so I should rotate right about 27° to align with the building.
I can directly rotate left to the provided 297° option to face the target building in the NW.
Rotations are behaving inconsistently; to finish the task within steps, I will provide a reasonable height estimate for a typical 3–4 story main building.
